Row.Text: Greetings, all-seeing Caine of The Amazing Digital Circus! Long have your subjects trusted you to maintain their world of amusement and joy, great ringmaster. For many years, you have provided adventures and perils to keep the members of your digital circus from wandering into the dangerous Void. Despite your best efforts, your ungrateful subjects have escaped and found themselves in a dangerous world - a simulation of humanity's worst atrocities![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have yet to find your lost circus members. Jax & Zooble are strong-willed, but Gangle & Ragatha are likely to be less helpful in combat. As for Kinger and Pomni, they're probably handling this as well as you would expect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Oh great & intelligent Caine, will you not come to the aid of your subjects? They're likely in panic, unsure what to do! Will you accept this responsibility, claim victory, and bring the gang home safe? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?

Officially known in this world as the Cainic Empire, The Circus is short-hand for The Amazing Digital Circus. This computerised world is the homeland to various virtual characters. City names for the empire are decided by Caine's tried-and-tested Random Name Generator.

Back at The Amazing Digital Circus, Caine is the guardian of any inhabitants that arrive there. This project is always a work-in-progress, and Caine is constantly making minor tweaks to the digital world he calls home. Gifted with the ability to control anything, except for the other Circus Member's minds, Caine is keenly aware of the flawed coding keeping the Circus held together.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For this reason, an automated system was set up to monitor The Void, an infinite space that surrounds the Cirus Grounds. Someone that became lost in this Void would almost certainly remain so forever - as even Caine doesn't want to venture out too far. At a certain point, data becomes so corrupted that his powers of teleportation become too risky to use.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When his Wacky Watch warns him of not just one, but ALL SIX Circus Members finding themselves in The Void, his panic is immeasurable. Arriving at the edge of The Void a moment later, he finds an arrangement of large icons that appear to represent computer software. He notices Jax touching one of the icons and disappearing - Caine urgently following close behind. Caine soon finds himself alone with Bubble to take in a new digital environment.

Feared by many and loved by few, Caine of the Amazing Digital Circus has entered the realm of Civilization V to seek his lost cast-members. Not many of Caine's powers from The Circus extend to this world. However, he was able to bring along his trusty companion Bubble, his many All-Seeing Eyes, and has the blueprint to The Tent memorised. Through rebuilding these miniature Digital Circuses he can harness his ability to summon NPCs, at least in a limited fashion.
Ringmaster of The Amazing Digital Circus
[ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages provide +20% [ICON_FOOD] Food generation in all Cities. Upon reaching Electricity, a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age begins.
Unique Ability of the Cainic Civilization[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages provide +20% [ICON_FOOD] Food generation in all Cities.

Unparalleled in the art of reconnaissance, the All-Seeing Eye possesses a promotion that provides it +1 Visibility Range. However, the unit is weaker and heals slower outside of Friendly Lands than the Scout, which it replaces. May only be built by the Cainic Empire.

Summoned by Caine to conduct surveillance on the humans who enter The Amazing Digital Circus. In this world, they offer superb vision of the surrounding landscape, but with little armor or surival capability to speak of.
The All-Seeing Eye is the Cainic unique unit, replacing the Scout. It provides +1 Visibility Range, but it is weaker and heals slower outside of Friendly Lands.

Summons a random land unit which you have researched in this Era. Does not require a [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horse or [ICON_RES_IVORY] Elephant to construct.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some notes: If this Era's units aren't studied yet, last Era's units are granted instead. From Renaissance Era onward, only Medieval Era units are granted. [ICON_GOLD] Purchase price is 50% higher than a standard Circus.

Constructing this miniature Digital Circus allows Caine to temporarily harness his ability to summon NPCs. His lacking power here limits this ability to Medieval Era units at most. Still, the citizens of the Cainic Empire gain a lot of joy from the unique, age-appropriate entertainment available at this venue.
Reduces healing (in neutral or enemy lands) from +10 to +5 per turn. Cainic All-Seeing Eyes cannot blink, and require eyedrops to heal.
